description:
doc: add "The go command" article based on Russ' mail

This is a philosophical document. We can soup it up at a later stage,
but for now it's nice to have a URL to point to that isn't a mailing
list post.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg

i'd rather have the document called "the go command" be closer to a manual; moreover, this doesn't feel like the right page to be the first to get checked in.

the go command needs docs, but this isn't the one i want to see go out first.
i'd like to fix the goinstall references before submitting

http://codereview.appspot.com/5676061/diff/6001/doc/articles/go_command.html File doc/articles/go_command.html (right): http://codereview.appspot.com/5676061/diff/6001/doc/articles/go_command.html#newcode5 doc/articles/go_command.html:5:

The Go distribution includes a command, named "go", that link to godoc output for cmd/go http://codereview.appspot.com/5676061/diff/6001/doc/articles/go_command.html#newcode12 doc/articles/go_command.html:12:

You might have seen early Go talks in which Rob jokes that the idea s/Rob/Rob Pike/ http://codereview.appspot.com/5676061/diff/6001/doc/articles/go_command.html#newcode49 doc/articles/go_command.html:49: the last few years we have consistently reminded people about the s/have // http://codereview.appspot.com/5676061/diff/6001/doc/articles/go_command.html#newcode50 doc/articles/go_command.html:50: goinstall command and its conventions: first, that the import path is there is no goinstall command s/goinstall command/old & (now replaced by go get)/ http://codereview.appspot.com/5676061/diff/6001/doc/articles/go_command.html#newcode56 doc/articles/go_command.html:56: code. Today, the vast majority of packages I see mentioned are s/I see mentioned // http://codereview.appspot.com/5676061/diff/6001/doc/articles/go_command.html#newcode75 doc/articles/go_command.html:75:

The go command retains the conventions established by the goinstall s/goinstall/old &/ http://codereview.appspot.com/5676061/diff/6001/doc/articles/go_command.html#newcode81 doc/articles/go_command.html:81: main URL, without the http:// prefix. Subdirectories are named by http:// http://codereview.appspot.com/5676061/diff/6001/doc/articles/go_command.html#newcode100 doc/articles/go_command.html:100: in an known way from the import path. Specifically, the first choice s/an/a/ http://codereview.appspot.com/5676061/diff/6001/doc/articles/go_command.html#newcode118 doc/articles/go_command.html:118: for many of the go command's commands, as we'll see below.

s2/command/sub&/ http://codereview.appspot.com/5676061/diff/6001/doc/articles/go_command.html#newcode133 doc/articles/go_command.html:133: example, if we allowed extra configuration like compiler flags or s/like/such as/ http://codereview.appspot.com/5676061/diff/6001/doc/articles/go_command.html#newcode136 doc/articles/go_command.html:136: to the use of a specific toolchain.

s/toolchain/tool chain/ http://codereview.appspot.com/5676061/diff/6001/doc/articles/go_command.html#newcode140 doc/articles/go_command.html:140:

Finally, a quick tour of how to use the go command. Assuming you want refer to code.html Finally, a quick tour of how to use the go command, to supplement the information in code.html, which you might want to read first. http://codereview.appspot.com/5676061/diff/6001/doc/articles/go_command.html#newcode233 doc/articles/go_command.html:233: package into the pkg directory. Because the go command can analyze the (A reminder: the old "goinstall" is replace by "go get"; "go install" serves a different purpose.) note to us: rewrite this soon to get rid of goinstall. maybe even now. http://codereview.appspot.com/5676061/diff/6001/doc/articles/go_command.html#newcode258 doc/articles/go_command.html:258: "go get" without needing don't need to obtain and build s/don't need /
